result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cecil Miller II

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cecil Miller II appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Cecil Miller II.  Attorney Ryan Jay Michaels in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a DPA hearing. For reasons stated on the record, defense counsel requests an adjourned DPA hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Cecil Miller II appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Cecil Miller II.  Attorney Ryan Jay Michaels in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests a DPA hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Cecil Miller in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery and an offer from the State, but needs additional time to review with client. Court adjourns case for a scheduling conference to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cecil Miller in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-trial conference held. Defense counsel needs discovery and an offer from the State and requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Actual Date Bond Posted with Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff's Department 5/18/2022
Actual Date Bond Posted with Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff's Department 5/18/2022
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff's Department 5/18/2022

Cash bail bond previously posted to be returned to remitter.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KFB.

Defendant Cecil Miller in court.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 29 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-23-2022 @1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on June 23, 2022 at 1:00 PM.
